byline.contributor: Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Hong Kong and Adam Wu from Beijing

abstract: YouTube video created by basketball fan Hsiu-Chen Kuei demonstrates that Charlotte Hornets guard Jeremy Lin, American-born son of immigrants from Taiwan, is victim of excessive physicality from opponents and insufficient protection from NBA and its referees; NBA is aware of video, which has attracted close to million views, and stands by handling of plays and calls made.
lead_paragraph: The video, showing the Asian-American player being fouled hard but never “flagrantly,” is meant to question fairness in the N.B.A., but much of the discussion has been about Lin’s race.

headline.main: Open Season on Jeremy Lin? In Video, Fan Highlights Hard Fouls
headline.print_headline: A Fan Asks If Lin’s Race Leads to Bias by Referees
